GDPR.TEXT_10: . The photos you add will be stored in
GDPR.TEXT_10B: . All the data will be only shown to you because is private.
GDPR.TEXT_11: What happens when you buy a license?
GDPR.TEXT_12: In this case we will only and exclusively store the payment date. The rest of the information such as card number and passwords to access payment accounts, will be stored by Paypal, a third party to whom you send your data from your browser. If you need more information, you can read Paypal's privacy policy
GDPR.TEXT_15: What happens when you interact with another user?
GDPR.TEXT_16: Tradheo will store any interaction you make with other users and adapt the application to your wishes. The messages in the chat will be stored too for later recoveries. That is why we will store them in our servers and
GDPR.TEXT_19: Can I browse the Tradheo application without transferring personal data?
GDPR.TEXT_2: Tradheo is a university project, without legal status. We hope it would be the seed of a future society, meanwhile you can find us at
GDPR.TEXT_20: Tradheo needs your personal data in order to offer you the best possible experience, and it is really important for us to control people creating multiple accounts, so it is impossible to navigate without giving them away.
GDPR.TEXT_21: If you do not accept this question you can leave here:
GDPR.TEXT_23: At any time you can request the deletion of your personal data and we will do everything we can to respect your privacy. You can ask for it, in your profile page.
GDPR.TEXT_23B: The same way, if you want to access your data, you can ask for them in the app setting page and you will receive a message in your email account with them.
GDPR.TEXT_23C: Every time you need, you can change your personal data editing them in your profile
GDPR.TEXT_25: A cookie is an information file that the Tradheo server sends to your device (computer, smartphone, tablet, etc.), to store information about the navigation from your device.
GDPR.TEXT_27: We use technical Cookies that are those that allow the user to navigate through the application and select the different options or services in it, such as choosing a language and identifying the session.
GDPR.TEXT_29: We will also use Marketing Cookies managed by third parties. These cookies are used to pass information about your visit and thus adapt the displayed ads and assign commissions for referred sales.
GDPR.TEXT_3: What do we do with your personal data?
GDPR.TEXT_30: How can I control the use of cookies?
GDPR.TEXT_31: The user can - at any time - choose which cookies he wants to work on this website through the browser settings; for example:
GDPR.TEXT_35: According to the regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and the Council of April 27, 2016, regarding the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data, the consent on the part of the user must be absolutely clear. If this is the first time you visit us (or you have deleted our cookies) a pop-up window will be displayed so that you accept our privacy policy in such a way that if you ignore the message and continue browsing you will be accepting our privacy.
GDPR.TEXT_37: A data breach is any occasion where security measures have been deliberately or accidentally circumvented in order to access, alter, disclose or destroy personal information.
GDPR.TEXT_38: For example, if unauthorised parties have gained access to and potentially obtained copies of our information systems.
GDPR.TEXT_39: In that case, we will inform the Information Commissioners Office (ICO) within 72 hours of becoming aware of it. And in the unlikely event that there is a personal data breach that represents a risk to individuals or their businesses,
GDPR.TEXT_4: In Tradheo we only store personal data to allow users have the best possible experience and to avoid people create multiple accounts. We want you to know what happens when you enjoy our application, so we will show you the scenarios in which you give us personal data. That way you will be aware and you can exercise your rights.
GDPR.TEXT_40: we will inform you by email within 72 hours too.
GDPR.TEXT_5: What happens when you sign up?
GDPR.TEXT_6: In this case we are storing in our cloud database the data you provide us in the Tradheo's sign up form hosted on Heroku servers. These data are necessary to know who you are and show your information to other users, asswell as prevent you to create multiple free accounts. Heroku has secure servers that use encrypted connections for transfering the data. Its privacy policy can be found
GDPR.TEXT_7: Your profile photo, that identify you to other users, will be stored on Cloudinary servers whose privacy policy can be found
GDPR.TEXT_8: What happens when you create a new simulation?
GDPR.TEXT_9: We will keep all the data you provide us stored in our cloud database and in
GDPR.TEXT_9B: to show them to other users.
GDPR.TITLE: General Data Protection Regulation
